result.execSummary:
The defendant Lazirick C Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Repeater, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment or attend school full time or a combination of both equal to full time. No contact with the victims. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Per RASO - defendant has been transferred to the prison system

Defendant Lazirick C Williams in court with attorney Erin Joy Larsen.  Defendant Lazirick C Williams in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The State is in compliance with Ch. 950. Parties have reviewed PSI. No additions or corrections noted by parties, however, Ms. Larsen indicates that on the face sheet, the max number of years is misstated. The State agrees. 

BTC: Total sentence is 6 yrs WPS bifurcated as 3 yrs IC, 3 yrs ES/CFTS. The weapon is to be destroyed after the appellate time has expired

Conditions:
obey all rules and regs
costs
DNA sample & costs
no alc/cs except by Rx-UA's
any counseling deemed approp by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care
FT emp/school = FT
no contact with the victims

FAW/vote

IS eligible for CIP and SAP

Upon plea to Ct 2 of the amended information, Ct 1 is DRI. The State recommends WPS-ss as to amount and will argue facts and circumstances.
P-NC

the deft waives right to JT
the State relies on comp for FB - defense stipulates to same
finding of guilt

BTC: guilty as above. PSI ordered  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 10:45 am.

Defendant Lazirick C Williams in court with attorney Erin Joy Larsen.  Defendant Lazirick C Williams in custody.  W. Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defendant wishes to change his plea but wishes to have a little more time to discuss details with Ms. Larsen.  Plea hearing scheduled for February 5, 2016 at 10:00 am.
ATTY Larsen files Motion to Exclude or Limit Testimony.

Ct 1: 940.01(1)(a)-First Degree Int. Homicide/repeater-use of dangerous weapon; Ct 2: 941.30(1)-1st Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety/repeater/use of dangerous weapon.  Conditions:  Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.  No contact with the victims, DS and DW (person, property, residence or family).   You have been ordered to have to provide a DNA sample as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Monday through Friday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:30 a.m.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Lazirick C Williams in court with attorney Erin Joy Larsen.  Defendant Lazirick C Williams in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense files bond motion this morning. Defense asks that bond be reduced per her motion. The State indicates that Ch. 950 has been complied with. The State objects to the bond modification as requested by Defense arguing the exposure the deft faces and there is evidence statements were made by deft as well as the crime lab that was owned and registered to deft/used in the commission in this offense. The State believes $4,000.00 is inadequate.

BTC: Bond modification is granted but will only reduce bond to $50,000.00 cash. Same terms and conditions remain

Bail/bond hearing at 11-25-2015 09:00 am.
Motion hearing at 02-04-2016 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lazirick C Williams in court with attorney Erin Joy Larsen.  Defendant Lazirick C Williams in custody.  W Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Ms. Larsen is recently appointed and is now in receipt of the electronic and paper discovery. Ms. Larsen is looking for a bail motion and a Daubert hearing.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for November 25, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Motion hearing scheduled for February 4, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lazirick C Williams in court with attorney Gregory Austin Holdahl for Erin Larsen.  Defendant Lazirick C Williams in custody.  W Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense asks for a short status so Ms. Larsen may appear  Status conference scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lazirick C Williams in court with attorney Eugene Loftin.  Defendant Lazirick C Williams in custody.  W Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Marilyn Leedle.
Ms. Larsen took over from Mr. Loftin and the State indicates that defendant has most discovery. The State has released electronic discovery  Status conference scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 10:00 am.
From defendant re: appointing new counsel.
in support of Motion; filed by Atty Loftin.
to withdraw; filed by Atty Loftin. Proposed Order attached. Fwd to Judge to review/signature.

Defendant Lazirick C Williams in court with attorney Eugene Loftin.  Defendant Lazirick C Williams in custody.  W Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The State indicates that they are in trial posture, however, last week there were several messages from lead Inv. Klinkhammer that someone in the jail wanted to speak to him about this case. Inv. Klinkhammer indicates that this person could be a potential witness but the person is represented by counsel. Atty Loftin was made aware of this on Friday. Inv. Klinkhammer interviewed this witness and the report was available to defense Monday, 10/12. The State indicates he was told by defense that they would be withdrawing their speedy trial demand to allow them time to investigate the matter. Defense takes time to discuss the matter with deft. Defendant is asking that Mr. Loftin withdraw as he is unsatisfied with the representation of Mr. Loftin.

BTC: Mr. Loftin is allowed to withdraw. SPD to reappoint  Status conference scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
For Defendant to come from Robert Ellsworth Correctional Union Grove, WI to Racine County Jail on October 13, 2015 @ 1:30 PM for a Jury Trial

Defendant Lazirick C Williams in court with attorney Eugene Loftin.  Defendant Lazirick C Williams in custody.  W Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Parties are ready to proceed to trial. The State indicates that negotiations continue. Sequestration is granted.. All other of the State's MIL are granted. Officer Kevin Klinkhammer may be designated the State's representative. Defense MIL are granted. Victim may be referred to as 'alleged victim'.  The State indicates that he spoke with defense prior to going on the record regarding a statement given to Inv. Klinkhammer and the defense is not contesting that it was a non-custodial statement. BTC: The Court will defer ruling on Miranda/Goodchild hearing until the day of trial.
No Daubert challenges. All witnesses are available nor Crime Lab issues. The State indicates this will be a 2 day trial. 1 alternate, 5 strikes.  The Court will give the following preliminary instructions 50, 103, 148, 55, 58, 300, 140, 101.

BTC: JT remains. The Court would like jury instructions on individual pages. The State will make corrections and resubmit

Notice of Assignment of Judge
RTS, Not Deliverable As Addressed, UTF
